problem.title: The Problem
problem.subtitle: Why small online shops need AI automation
problem.intro: Small and medium online shops face growing challenges: customers expect fast 24/7 support, accounting consumes valuable time, and personnel costs keep rising. Meanwhile, they lack the resources of large corporations.

support.title: 24/7 Customer Service
support.description: Customers expect instant answers — even at 11 PM. Small shops can't afford a round-the-clock support team. Dissatisfied customers switch to competitors.

accounting.title: Manual Accounting
accounting.description: Consolidating financial data from multiple sources, calculating KPIs, and creating reports — all of this costs hours per week and is error-prone.

scaling.title: Growth Without Extra Costs
scaling.description: More orders mean more support requests and more administrative work. Staff doesn't scale linearly — AI does.

problem.conclusion: ShopControl AI solves exactly these problems: A fully autonomous AI email support agent handles customer service while financial reporting runs automatically in the background.

solution.title: The Solution
solution.subtitle: Two AI pillars for the modern online shop
solution.intro: ShopControl AI combines two powerful automation systems in one solution: an intelligent email support agent and fully automatic financial reporting.

support.title: AI Email Support Agent
support.description: A fully autonomous email support agent that independently analyzes, processes, and answers incoming customer inquiries via email — with access to real-time shop data via Shopify and a company-specific knowledge base.

features.f2: RAG-based knowledge from shop documents via Pinecone
features.f3: Shopify integration for order status, products & returns
features.f4: Escalation to human support when needed via Google Sheets

accounting.title: Automatic Financial Reporting
accounting.description: Financial data from Shopify, Facebook Ads, and bank accounts is automatically consolidated and sent as visualized reports with relevant KPIs via WhatsApp — on demand or automatically every month.

features.f1: Data retrieval from Shopify, Facebook Ads & bank accounts
features.f2: Automatic calculation of key KPIs (revenue, ad spend, profit)
features.f3: Visualized reports with charts sent via WhatsApp
features.f4: Triggered monthly automatically or manually via WhatsApp message

technology.title: Technology
technology.subtitle: How ShopControl AI works under the hood
technology.overview: ShopControl AI is built on n8n workflows that orchestrate two main systems: a fully autonomous AI email support agent with RAG knowledge retrieval and automated financial reporting. Here we show step by step how each email inquiry is processed.

step1.title: Email Retrieval
step1.description: The workflow starts by retrieving all new emails from Gmail. From each email thread, only the latest message is extracted, as it contains the current customer inquiry. This ensures that in ongoing conversations, the most recent message is always processed.

step2.title: Filtering
step2.description: In the second step, all emails are automatically filtered. Promotional emails, automated notifications, and newsletters are sorted out. An AI checks whether the remaining messages are genuine support requests. Additionally, emails are checked for policy violations. Only genuine, appropriate customer inquiries proceed further.

step3.title: Image Analysis
step3.description: If images are attached to the email, such as photos of damaged products, they are analyzed separately by an AI. The system recognizes what is shown in the images and creates a textual description as additional context for the support agent.

step4.title: Support Agent Processing
step4.description: The AI support agent processes the inquiry. It takes the email text along with any image descriptions and autonomously decides which tools it needs — e.g., the Shopify agent for order data or the RAG knowledge base for return policies. Based on all collected information, it generates a well-founded response.

step5.title: Email Dispatch
step5.description: Before the response is sent, it passes through an automatic security check (Output Guardrails) that verifies the response is correct, complete, and appropriately worded. Only after this validation passes is the reply email actually sent.

step6.title: Performance Logging
step6.description: In the final step, the entire process is documented: which inquiry came in, which tools were used, what was answered, and how long processing took. This performance data is stored in Google Sheets, enabling long-term monitoring and optimization.

rag.title: RAG System
rag.subtitle: Retrieval-Augmented Generation in Detail
rag.description: RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) enables the AI agent to access company-specific knowledge. Documents like FAQs, product catalogs, and return policies are converted into vectors and stored in the Pinecone vector database. With each inquiry, the most relevant text passages are automatically found, ranked by a Cohere Reranker for relevance, and provided to the agent as context. An embedding model converts texts into mathematical representations, so the search works by meaning rather than exact words.
rag.caption: The RAG upload workflow automatically converts documents into vectors for Pinecone

tool1.title: Chat Memory / PostgreSQL
tool1.description: The agent has a memory stored in a Supabase/PostgreSQL database. For returning customers, it can retrieve previous communication and specifically reference it.

tool2.title: Shopify Agent
tool2.description: A specialized sub-agent that communicates directly with the Shopify API: retrieve order data, check shipping status, create returns in the system, and query customer data for personalized responses.

tool3.title: Support Case Agent / Sheets Agent
tool3.description: When the agent cannot resolve an inquiry on its own, the Sheets Agent creates a documented support case in Google Sheets — a structured request that a human specialist can process later.

security.title: Security & Reliability
security.subtitle: Four layers of protection for production use

security1.title: Jailbreak Detection
security1.description: Detection of manipulation attempts where people try to trick the system with specially crafted messages to bypass security guidelines. The agent does not respond to such requests.

security2.title: NSFW Content Filter
security2.description: Automatic filtering of inappropriate or offensive content. For such requests, a polite standard response is sent referencing the communication guidelines.

security3.title: Topical Alignment
security3.description: Topic relevance check that ensures the inquiry fits the defined scope. General knowledge questions or off-topic content are detected and answered accordingly.

security4.title: Output Guardrails
security4.description: Output safety barriers: A separate AI model checks the generated response for correctness, completeness, and appropriateness. Only when all checks pass is the response actually sent.

security.caption: Multi-layered security mechanisms protect against manipulation and errors

supportAgent.title: AI Support Agent
supportAgent.subtitle: Fully autonomous AI-powered email customer support

problem.title: The Problem
problem.description: Small online store owners spend hours daily handling repetitive support inquiries — order status, returns, product questions. This ties up valuable time that could be spent on growth.

solution.title: The Solution
solution.description: A fully autonomous AI agent that handles email inquiries independently — from analysis through research to personalized responses. Without human intervention, around the clock.

workflow.title: 6-Step Workflow
workflow.subtitle: How the agent processes each customer inquiry

step1.title: Fetch Emails
step1.description: The workflow is triggered on a schedule and retrieves all new emails from the support inbox via IMAP.

step2.title: Filter Emails
step2.description: Auto-replies, newsletters, and irrelevant messages are filtered out. Only genuine customer inquiries are processed further.

step3.title: Image Analysis
step3.description: If the email contains images (e.g., photos of damaged products), these are analyzed using GPT-4o Vision and the description is added to the context.

step4.title: AI Agent Processes Request
step4.description: The main agent analyzes the inquiry, uses RAG for knowledge base search, and accesses tools like the Shopify API and Google Sheets to retrieve relevant data.

step5.title: Send Response
step5.description: The generated response is formatted as a professional email and automatically sent to the customer.

step6.title: Performance Logging
step6.description: Every processed inquiry is logged — response time, token usage, model used, and category — for quality control and optimization.

rag.title: RAG Knowledge System
rag.description: The agent uses Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) with a Qdrant vector database. Product information, FAQ entries, and company policies are stored as embeddings and searched with every inquiry.
rag.link: More about the technical architecture on the Technology page.

tools.title: Tools & Sub-Agents
tools.description: The agent accesses specialized tools: Shopify API for order data, Google Sheets for internal data, and a returns management sub-agent for complex return cases.
tools.link: Details about tool integration on the Technology page.

security.title: Security Features
security.description: Four security layers protect against malfunctions: error triggers on workflow failures, confidence-based escalation to humans, automatic backup responses, and complete response logging.
security.link: More about security concepts on the Technology page.
